summary:
Bosnia and Herzegovina is a country in Southeast Europe, located on the Balkan Peninsula. It shares borders with Serbia, Montenegro, and Croatia, and has a short coastline on the Adriatic Sea. The country has a varied landscape, from mountains to flatlands. Sarajevo is the capital.

People have lived here since ancient times, with various civilizations, including Illyrian and Celtic, settling in the region. It was part of different empires, including the Ottoman and Austro-Hungarian, before becoming a part of Yugoslavia. After Yugoslavia's breakup, Bosnia gained independence in 1992, but faced the Bosnian War.

Today, it is a developing country with a unique ethnic makeup, including Bosniaks, Serbs, and Croats as the main groups.
title: Bosnia and Herzegovina
